mdRecord.dcterms:title: Albert I, King of the Belgians Arrives at the Mount Vernon Wharf, October 29, 1919
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: National Pictorial News
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Albert I, King of the Belgians, 1875-1934
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white photographic print of Albert I, King of the Belgians and his party arriving at the Mount Vernon wharf. In the foreground, King Albert is second from the left, next to Vice President Marshall (top hat and cane) and Mount Vernon Resident Superintendent Harrison H. Dodge (far right of forefront individuals). The photographer's stamp appears on the reverse. A handwritten caption (by Harrison Dodge) reads: 'Belgian King, Queen & Crown Prince just after landing at Mt. Vernon wharf. (All appear to be hopping) Oct 29, 1919'
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Wharf
Potomac River
